text: Jacqueline Wing Ying Siu (born 8 December 1982) is an dressage rider from Hong Kong. She is the first equestrian to win a gold medal in the 2018 Asian Games in Jakarta. == Early life and career == Jacqueline was born in Hong Kong. She started riding horses when she was five years old. When Siu was ten, she moved to England with her family. She kept on riding horses and raced for Great Britain at the European Youth Championships. In 2005, she started to race under the Hong Kong flag. Siu started to compete at a higher level and later moved to the Netherlands. In the Netherlands, Siu started training with Anky van Grunsven. Siu was at the Doha 2006, Guangzhou 2010, Incheon 2014, 2018 Asian Games in Jakarta, Indonesia, and the Hangzhou 2022. In 2018, she also was in the World Equestrian Games in Tryon. == Related pages == * Caroline Chew * Yui Hasegawa * Mana Iwabuchi == References == == Other websites == * Category:1982 births Category:Dressage riders Category:Hong Kong sportspeople Category:Medalists at the 2018 Asian Games Category:Living people
title: Jacqueline Siu
